messageBody:
Thanks for your valuable advise. I am planning to refractor the application
using Divide and Conquer technique. And would follow the Bottom up approach.
I also found Eric's Solution of Level Testing, really he had explained good
strategy of Application testing.

Thanks.

Sukhvinder Singh.
"War has begun."

From: "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, February 27, 2003 12:05 AM
Subject: Re: [junit] Need help!!


> If you want to do true unit tests -- that is, testing individual
> software components -- then first identify the area you are most
> interested in testing: handling a request, building a response, data
> access, selecting business logic, whatever. Next, try writing a JUnit
> test that uses JUST THAT PORTION of your server application. If you
> find that you can't do that without involving other pieces of the
> application, then you have some dependency splitting to do. Divide and
> conquer, divide and conquer.
>
> As for specific techniques, those depend on your specific situation.
>
> Ask your next question.
>
> So said Sukhvinder Singh Namdhari on 2004-02-26 --------------------
>
> >Hi,
> >
> >I have query regarding Unit Tests, I want to write unit tests for my
> >Server application, but till now we haven't wrote any testing code,
> the
> >application is ready and we are doing Smoke tests and regression
> tests.
> >Anyone could suggest how I could apply unit test technique in the
> existing
> >Server Application, what should be the approach for Unit tests.
> >Any help would be appreciable.
> >
> >thanks,
